references.paper_title: Smoothed analysis of algorithms: Why the simplex algorithm usually takes polynomial time
references.reason: This paper introduced the concept of smoothed analysis, the theoretical framework used in this paper to analyze the robustness of gradient-based algorithms for solving zero-sum games.
This paper provides state-of-the-art algorithms for solving matrix games, which are closely related to the algorithms analyzed in this paper.

references.paper_title: On linear convergence of iterative methods for the variational inequality problem
references.reason: This paper established fundamental results on the linear convergence of gradient methods for solving variational inequalities, which are crucial to understanding the high-precision behavior of gradient-based algorithms for zero-sum games.

references.paper_title: Linear last-iterate convergence in constrained saddle-point optimization
references.reason: This paper provides a detailed analysis of the linear convergence rate of several gradient-based algorithms for solving zero-sum games, including the key concept of metric subregularity, which is used in this paper's analysis.

references.paper_title: Last-iterate convergence: Zero-sum games and constrained min-max optimization
references.reason: This paper analyzed the last-iterate convergence of gradient-based algorithms for solving zero-sum games and constrained min-max optimization problems, which is highly relevant to the main focus of this paper.
